precontext: Emma glanced at her phone, checking the time. The evening plans were about to start, and she felt pressure from her friends. They were all eager to see what the night had in store.
sentence: She really didn't want to go to the trailer tonight.
meanings_considered: an advertisement consisting of short scenes from a motion picture that will appear in the near future
a wheeled vehicle that can be pulled by a car or truck and is equipped for occupancy
explanation:
• The phrase "go to the trailer" in the context of evening plans and social pressure strongly suggests a place where people gather, making the vehicle meaning (2) plausible.  
• The meaning of "trailer" as a movie advertisement (1) does not fit, as it would be odd to say someone "goes to" a trailer in the sense of a film preview, especially when the context involves physical plans and social obligations.  
• The precontext, involving friends, evening plans, and pressure, implies a physical location, not a promotional video, further supporting the vehicle interpretation.
clear_meaning_text: a wheeled vehicle that can be pulled by a car or truck and is equipped for occupancy
